takeaway_rubric:
1. Length: Write a clear, tightly written takeaway in 3–4 sentences (approx. 70–90 words).
2. Company Name: Mention the specific company using the GenAI tool.
3. Tool Used: Name the AI tool/platform used (e.g., Gemini, Claude) and clarify if the company built it or is using an external one.
4. Quantitative Evidence: Include quantitative metrics (revenue, % gains, time savings, scale of deployment) only if present in the source.
5. Business Impact: Clearly state the strategic benefit or performance improvement delivered by the AI tool.
6. Operational Alignment: Align the takeaway to Crocs’ operational categories (ecommerce, BI, product recs, supply chain, creative, etc.).
7. Category Tag: Assign the correct Category label (e.g., Business Intelligence, Enterprise Chat).
8. Strategic Framing: Frame why this matters to business/retail/enterprise audiences. Add a human/intent-oriented insight where appropriate.
9. No Visionary or Promotional Fluff: Avoid generic claims, vendor promotion, or visionary statements unless backed by specific actions, tools, and outcomes.
10. Plain Language: Write in simple, business-friendly language. Avoid jargon and technical complexity.
